event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A fatal error was detected within a PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A fatal error was detected within a PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip.



   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:


         Domain associated with the PCI-X slot and the internal I/O is reset.

         PCI-X slot and all internal I/O are deconfigured after the domain resets.

         Internal I/O consists of SAS Controller, Gigabit Ethernet, Disks, DVD, and Tape.



   SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:


         Domain associated with the PCI-X slot and the internal I/O is reset.

         PCI-X slot and all internal I/O are deconfigured after the domain resets.

         Internal I/O consists of SAS Controller, Gigabit Ethernet, Disks, DVD, and Tape.

            IOU#0: Internal I/O includes the DVD drive, the DAT drive, HDD#0 and HDD#1.
            IOU#1: Internal I/O includes HDD#2 and HDD#3.



   External IO Expansion Unit (IOX):


         Domain using the PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip on one boat of an External IO Expansion Unit is reset.

         All PCI-Express slots or PCI-X slots on one boat of an External IO Expansion Unit
         are deconfigured after the domain resets.

         The deconfiguration is not persistent across platform power cycles
         or across Dynamic Reconfiguration operations.


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:08:05 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: e33da8a2-030d-4451-bd56-1d1be8b3acf2
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8001-TS for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8001-TS, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:08:05 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: e33da8a2-030d-4451-bd56-1d1be8b3acf2
   DESC: A fatal error was detected within a PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip.
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8001-TS for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: All internal I/O behind the PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip is deconfigured (if the
   PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip is located on an IOU or IOUA) or all the PCI-X slots
   in an I/O Boat are deconfigured (if the PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip is located on
   an I/O Boat).
   IMPACT: The domain using the PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip is reset.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
   

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u e33da8a2-030d-4451-bd56-1d1be8b3acf2

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:08:05.6590 e33da8a2-030d-4451-bd56-1d1be8b3acf2 SCF-8001-TS
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.io.pciex.bridge.fe

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0/leaf=0/pci_br=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0/leaf=0/pci_br=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                             part=CA20393-B55X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/IOU#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The domain using the PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip is reset.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: All internal I/O behind the PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip is deconfigured (if the PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip is located on an IOU or IOUA) or all the PCI-X slots in an I/O Boat are deconfigured (if the PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip is located on an I/O Boat).
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Fatal error was detected within a PCIe/PCI-X bridge chip.
